topics.body:
Serious posting and talking about that post on Ai I'm actually kind of surprised how ironically enough the current Ai development going is making leaps and bounds towards science fiction androids really.


I know I've joked a lot about how ridiculous that idea is, but the military is making fuck all advances; the business world is making fuck all advances also, the biggest leaps and bounds have been through institutes and the like.

I know it sounds hilariously laughable, and I'm sitting here going, "I don't believe it" either, but chances are yes you will get a android girlfriend cause the groups making the most headway have been the institutes looking towards making essentially synthetic human minds.

In a way it kind of makes sense though; they're not building Ai from the ground up; rather they're reverse engineering the human brain and putting it into computer format so they don't necessarily need to build from the ground up, just create essentially a bootleg copy.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53afceb96368720c54ed0200#post_53afceb96368720c54ed0200
[bq="Number1pegasus"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53afcd096368720d11f10100#post_53afcd096368720d11f10100
>chances are yes you will get a android girlfriend 

My body was ready for this since the day I was born. [/bq]
Is this you after this post?
!http://i1.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/773/175/a26.gif!


But to simplify my post as simple as possible:
That branch of Ai development isn't actually developing Ai from the ground up, they're essentially copying how the brain works and putting it into computer format.  The other branches are having to do it completely from the ground up and won't be able to get done with that for at least fifty years so no AM will not happen cause that shit's decades upon decades upon decades off; scifi like Ai like Chobits, Aegis from persona or such is only about two decades off.

I need to save this gif. X3

Also, Ahh I see. 

Probably for the best, wouldn't want any Skynet shit happening. [/bq]
It's kind of hilarious in a way; scifi Ai girlfriends are more likely than something like Skynet.

The problem with Skynet and why it would take at least fifty years from now for something like that to happen is that you would need to program every single itty bitty little piece of it.  Aegis is likely to happen in the next two decades because you'll have a core Ai base, core program base and they'll grow into their own distinct personality and so forth.  They'll start with barely a personality then grow into it.

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53afd5636368720c549c0500#post_53afd5636368720c549c0500
[bq="Randomosaur"]Ray Kurzweil believes he will be able to resurrect his father digitally and perfectly based on notebooks and AI.

Sorry Ray, but that's pure and simple wishful thinking.[/bq]
Yeah; that's highly unlikely.


The more likely scenario is cookie cutter Ai's.  What I mean by this is that when they first come out there will be only one sort of type to save on programming and when we understand how Ai develop more versions later.  What I mean by this is the first version will be something like Alice-v.01 then we'll have Ted-v.02 & Alice-v.02 then we'll have Andy-v.03, Ted-v.03, Alice-v.03 and Rachel-v.03 and so forth.  So no; no resurrecting your dead relatives digitally.
